hideNoCombat.Name: Hide if no Combat
hideNoCombat.Hint: Hide the SCS App if there is no Combat active

hideTracker.Name: Hide Tracker
hideTracker.Hint: Enable this to hide the default combat tracker

limitCycles.Name: Limit Cycles
limitCycles.Hint: Move on to the next round of combat after the number of cycles configured below.

maxCycle.Name: Maximum Cycle
maxCycle.Hint: Set a maximum number of cycles before continuing on to the next round. You must enable Limit Cycles to use this.

limitPhases.Name: Limit Phases
limitPhases.Hint: Move on to the next round of combat at the end of each cycle of phases. This will override Limit Cycles above.

startupTutorial.Name: Play Startup Tutorial
startupTutorial.Hint: Disable this if you don't want the tutorial to display each time the page loads

phaseNames.Name: Phase Names
phaseNames.Hint: A comma-separated list of phase names (reloads page)

generateColors.Name: Change Colors
generateColors.Label: Generate
generateColors.Hint: Click to generate new random colors (reloads page)

alternateActive.Name: Alternate Appearance
alternateActive.Hint: Invert the appearance of the active phase, so that it's lighter than the others rather than darker

actionLocking.Name: Action Locking
actionLocking.Hint: Lock to only specific actions for known phases. Feel free to make suggestions for phases to add!

hudDisplay.Name: Attack Roll HUD
hudDisplay.Hint: Show the last attack roll in the token's HUD for aiding in determining attack order

trackerDisplay.Name: Attack Roll in the Combat Tracker
trackerDisplay.Hint: Show the last attack roll in the Combat Tracker next to each combatant's name

welcome.Title: Welcome to the SCS
welcome.Intro: This module is an implementation of the Simultaneous Combat System described in this reddit post.

howItWorks.Title: How it works
howItWorks.Intro:
Instead of each character taking their own turn sequentially, everything happens all at once.
In order to prevent total chaos, combat still happens in rounds and there is a structure to each round. That is, they are divided into resolution phases:

combatTracker.Title: Where is the combat tracker?
combatTracker.Intro: Since combat happens simultaneously with this system, I've removed the default combat tracker. You can always re-enable it in the module's settings.

movingAround.Title: How do I move this thing around?
movingAround.Intro: You can drag the app around by clicking and holding this text. It snaps to the bottom left corner, but will remember it's position wherever you choose to put it.
